Articles.Content:
I'd love to see a mod that shows a list of all the science parts on your craft with buttons for all the functions of each of the parts.

It would greatly simplify science gathering if you didn't have to visually locate the parts yourself to use them.

ScienceAlert does this - to an extent. It only shows you buttons for experiments you have not yet run in the current situation. If you wanted to take a temperature reading in a situation where you already have achieved 100% return value for some reason, then you'd need to hunt down that thermometer again.

However, those moments are fairly rare as far as my experience with the game goes.
You could also use (after its updated I think) ATG and bind every experiment to a key/button; you can also name them in the ATG window.
Part Commander can show you all your parts by category (Science, Utility, Aero, etc) with all the right-click menus.

I guess ScienceAlert comes closest, but it's still way too clunky and at the same time lacking everything but the basic functionality of collecting science.

The way I described it would be best. A dedicated window populated with all science parts with context menus for each part would be much more user-friendly.

Oh. I think Part Commander would be best actually. Thanks.

Edited November 11, 2015 by Cpt. Kipard

It sometimes happens for survey contracts, if I'm flying over a biome I've already studied. (Actually, this would be a great feature for ScienceAlert, to pull up the required experiment when you enter a waypoint.)
